conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible interior volume, angled/isometric-like camera, and roof/ceiling removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable interior volumes. Cutaway is clean and camera is angled; minor simplification in corner/junction detailing and some areas feel under-defined.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: large living area on left, dining at bottom center, kitchen on right, playroom-like large room top-right, and a central stair core. However, several wall lengths/proportions and some internal partitions appear simplified, and door/window locations are not faithfully represented.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/island are present, but most other furniture is absent or extremely minimal. Bathroom/closet detailing is not convincingly populated with fixtures.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean clay-style render with good readability of walls/floors and no UI/text contamination. Lighting is adequate, though lack of opening/trim detail reduces structural clarity.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows are largely missing or not placed/sized to match the 2D plan (few clear openings visible where the plan indicates many).
Some internal wall partitions and proportional relationships appear simplified versus the 2D plan (exact wall lengths/jogs not fully preserved).
Furniture and fixtures are incomplete: kitchen is represented, but living/dining/playroom/bath elements are mostly absent.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with broadly correct room arrangement, but reduced fidelity in partitions, openings (doors/windows), and interior fixture/furniture detailing.
